result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $1,700.00, Joint & Several with co-actor in 14CF1783, to be taken by the DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence *09-04-2018 amended to reflect sentence is consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Be given job & vocational training.  
Obtain/ maintain employment.
As a convicted felon, defendant not to possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant further advised of voting ineligibility.

NO CONTACT with the victims, Teri H., Dejevon C., Kevin B., or D. W. H. (DOB 11-20-2007).   
NO CONTACT with co-actor, Jovanta Cortez White.  
NO controlled substances.  
NO alcohol.

Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.
Parenting classes/ counseling.
Pay any balances remaining of the restitution, costs surcharges and disbursements as ordered.  Failure to pay amounts in full will result in a civil judgment.

AODA assessment and treatment.
Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample if not previously provided and pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements;  all to be taken by the DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /and supporting information, filed.

Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in Count 2. Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed but read in.  Defense counsel advised the court that his client would stipulate to restitution as to all three victims, even though only pleading to one count.   

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in Count 1 of the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties request another date for sentencing.  Court ordered same bail.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 4/07/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court by telephone, defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel contacted the court to advise that he would be unable to appear this afternoon.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the Court that they will be withdrawing their motion.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding his waiver of motion hearing and finds that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a motion hearing.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  File retained in court.
State's Response in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, received and filed.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file.  Defense counsel requested another date to provide additional information; State did not object.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel out ill.  Case adjourned to 12/22/14 at 8:30 a.m.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Kasen in court, defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO DISMISS

Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Stephen Dombrowski, Officer for Milwaukee Police Department.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and Court enters pleads not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in court with attorney Thomas J. Kasen.  Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel did not appear until approximately 4:30 p.m.  Due to the time of day and directive of the Chief Judge, case is not able to be commenced in a timely manner.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dejevon C., Kevin B., Terri H. and David H (dob 11/20/2007)

Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Kenbrell Martrell Hill in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. aa
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
